channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Can you please ask the gardeners team of council and etc to clean grass, grounds and the playground area nearby to be cleaned and to be kept in very good quality standards for the sake of all the residents of Kelly Avenue and Watts Street SE15 5GL., 19th June
item.description:
Please keep the grass and grounds in clean and tidy conditions on constant schedule. We shouldn't even spend our time to complain about cleanliness and tidiness conditions of the public areas such as parks, playgrounds and grass areas between the pavements and roads. It's absolutely common sense to keep it clean and tidy without us to need to complain about it, because it must be done constantly on arranged reasonable schedule.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Kelly Avenue, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large hole in the pavement due to broken drain., 19th June
item.description:
I tripped over this drain today and could have really hurt myself. I have moved the board belonging to the cocktail bar next to my office and placed it over the hole to avoid anyone else hurting themselves. This needs to be looked at immediately as the hole is massive and someone could get seriously hurt.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 144-146, Fetter Lane, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roots causing problems to property, 19th June
item.description:
I hope this message finds you well. I would like to raise a concern regarding a council owned tree outside my property of 14 Ling Road Erith DA8 3EJ The tree appears to be beginning to cause damage to my property. There are cracks in the concrete and the steps leading to the door are cracking and showing signs of tree life. I would appreciate if the tree can be assessed by a council arborist or relevant officer as soon as possible. Please advise me of the next steps or if you require me to provide any further information. Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Ling Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate down into the River is jammed, 19th June
item.description:
Hi, I'm part of the local friends group (managed by Geoff) and am regularly picking up litter around Glassmill Pond and on the Queensmead rec. To get into the channel through Queensmead rec I have to walk under the culvert at the bottom of Glassmill Lane. Ideally I would have access through the gate closest to the culvert by Martins Lane (this gate is close to the fixed ladder into the channel), however, the gate seems jammed. Please can this be looked into. Geoff has a key to the padlock which opens ok. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Lane, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Victoria Road near junction with Lynton, 19th June
item.description:
Street tree has multiple suckers which are now more than 2 metres tall and now block most of the pavement such that it is now impassable by people with disabilities, mobility scooters or wheelchairs or parents with push chairs

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Donaldson Road, London
